layoff_eligible.title: Layoff - Eligible for Benefits
layoff_eligible.description: You were laid off through no fault of your own and should be eligible for unemployment benefits.

immediateActions.title: File Unemployment Insurance Claim
immediateActions.description: Apply for unemployment benefits as soon as possible. You can file online or by phone.

immediateActions.title: Register for MassHire JobQuest
immediateActions.description: Create your profile on the required job search platform.

immediateActions.title: Gather Required Documents
immediateActions.description: Collect Social Security card, driver's license, and employment history for the past 18 months.

shortTermActions.title: Visit MassHire Career Center
shortTermActions.description: Schedule an appointment for personalized career counseling and job search assistance.

shortTermActions.title: Apply for Healthcare Coverage
shortTermActions.description: If you lost employer health insurance, apply for MassHealth or other coverage.

shortTermActions.title: Review Your Budget
shortTermActions.description: Assess your financial situation and identify areas to reduce expenses.

ongoingActions.title: Complete Weekly Certification
ongoingActions.description: Certify for benefits every week to continue receiving payments.

ongoingActions.title: Conduct Job Search Activities
ongoingActions.description: Search and apply for jobs, attend job fairs, and network with professionals.

ongoingActions.title: Explore Training Opportunities
ongoingActions.description: Consider workforce training programs to enhance your skills.

hiddenResources.name: Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program
hiddenResources.description: Help with heating and utility bills during unemployment

hiddenResources.name: Massachusetts Legal Aid
hiddenResources.description: Free legal representation for UI appeals if benefits are denied

fired_performance.title: Termination - Performance Issues
fired_performance.description: You were terminated for performance reasons. You may still be eligible for benefits depending on circumstances.

immediateActions.title: File Unemployment Insurance Claim
immediateActions.description: Apply for benefits despite termination - you may still qualify if the performance issues weren't willful misconduct.

immediateActions.title: Document Your Termination
immediateActions.description: Gather any documentation about your termination, including performance reviews and communications.

shortTermActions.title: Consider Legal Consultation
shortTermActions.description: If you believe the termination was unfair, consider speaking with an employment attorney.

ongoingActions.title: Focus on Skill Improvement
ongoingActions.description: Use this time to address any skill gaps that may have contributed to performance issues.

quit_good_cause.title: Voluntary Quit - Good Cause
quit_good_cause.description: You quit for reasons that may qualify as 'good cause' under Massachusetts law.

immediateActions.title: File Unemployment Insurance Claim
immediateActions.description: Apply for benefits and explain your reasons for quitting. Good cause reasons may make you eligible.

immediateActions.title: Document Your Reasons
immediateActions.description: Gather evidence supporting your good cause reasons (medical records, harassment documentation, etc.).

shortTermActions.title: Prepare for UI Interview
shortTermActions.description: You may need to participate in a fact-finding interview about your reasons for quitting.

health_disability.title: Health/Disability Related Separation
health_disability.description: Your employment ended due to health or disability issues.

immediateActions.title: Contact Mass Rehabilitation Commission
immediateActions.description: Get connected with vocational rehabilitation services and support.

immediateActions.title: Explore Disability Benefits
immediateActions.description: Research Social Security Disability or other disability benefit programs.

shortTermActions.title: Gather Medical Documentation
shortTermActions.description: Collect medical records and physician statements supporting your condition.

ongoingActions.title: Participate in Rehabilitation Services
ongoingActions.description: Work with MRC counselors on return-to-work planning and accommodations.
